paragraphs.text: Fearmongering in Sydney.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Australians turning on their televisions Monday morning to watch breakfast and cooking shows were instead greeted with news channels beaming minute-to-minute fearmongering of the ongoing siege at a chocolate shop in Sydney
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When customers and employees were taken hostage by a lone gunman
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a flag with"There is only one God" inscription in Arabic was held in the window
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: it was enough to hold the rest of the country hostage to their fears and TV screens
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Should it be that way and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what should an appropriate response look like?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: consider what this violent thug had designed our reaction to be
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The site of the siege was likely no afterthought - located in the heart of the Sydney CBD and directly opposite a major television station, the shop had made it ideal for the media to report on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Streets were cordoned off
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: public transport diverted
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a strong contingent of police sent to the Opera House
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: All made for good visuals of the incident and terror in an otherwise peaceful city
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even the most left-leaning and progressive members of parliament, like Greens MP Adam Bandt, who have repeatedly defended the Muslim community from unjust discrimination and generalisation, tweeted to their followers in the first hours of the siege that it was "terrifying"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Was it really?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Was it at all terrifying for you personally, Adam?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'd hate to know what the hostages experienced, including the two who were murdered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A strike in the public's dark
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: For once, Prime Minister Tony Abbott had a more mature response than his colleagues on the opposite side
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such a situation can "scare people out of being themselves", he said in his first press briefing, before urging all Australians to go about their business as usual
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Although he told the public to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activity to the authorities
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he said so with calm and caution
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Vitally, he avoided using the t-word at this early stage, or any formulation thereof
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: No doubt we have since learnt a lot more about this deranged outsider and his motives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is clear he had terrorist intent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His website, which was shut down during the final hours of the siege, had a message dated December 14, which described why Muslims "fight against the oppression and terrorism" of the US and its allies, including the UK and Australia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The rampant speculation before this was unnecessary and unhelpful, however
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: letting the siege sow fear, enough so to publicly describe it as "terrifying", was handing a victory to an extremist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With the hot Australian summer setting in, many people's minds turn to beer, barbeques, family, and Christmas presents, not the possibility of "politically motivated violence", as Abbott wisely phrased it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Intriguingly, Australians fear terrorism more than a foreign invasion, despite many believing we'd have no hope of fending off the latter and despite us never directly experiencing the former
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Given the opportunity
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to attribute a complexly motivated act to terrorism
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's no wonder this all-too-easy escape mechanism which avoids rigorous thought or objective analysis was adopted en masse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The most noted incidents in Australia's experience of terrorism have been mostly foreign tragedies, like the Bali bombings in 2002 and 2005, or the 2004 Australian embassy bombing in Jakarta
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Although the September raids and arrests of suspected domestic terrorists in Sydney and Brisbane set a new landscape and brought the thought of an attack to our own shores
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: they merely raised the thought, not the authentic actuality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The raids sparked limited local backlash against peaceful Muslims at the time
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this was both unwarranted and unwanted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Though it only goes to further support my thesis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Australians just aren't used to this sort of thing and thus are unpractised in their response
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That said
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it hasn't stopped thousands on social media to show solidarity with minorities through the #IllRideWithYou campaign
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Abbott government raised the domestic terrorism threat level to high before the September raids
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: many local commentators criticised what they branded as political theatre (both before and after the arrests)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To consider this is to suggest an even baser type of political animal than is presently expected by even the most cynical of observers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Would any rational actor toy with people's lives for short-term political ends in what was an unimportant political week?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What end does that even achieve?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Plainly, none, and it is sensationally conspiratorialist to suggest otherwise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To protest against such raids and continue looking at them through a political lens was just as unwarranted and unwanted as the racial-profiling and racial- hatred which events like these have sparked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Terrorism isn't something that we should let foster, anywhere
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the public reactions to the raids were unjustifiably sceptical in comparison to the response to the Sydney siege
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the authorities' heed for caution may have come too late for some
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Slipshod media reports that the flag held in the shop window was an ISIL flag - when it was not- may have already fuelled the imaginations of too many
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whatever
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the outcome of the full investigation, one thing remains clear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This was a tragic learning experience for the Australian media, public, and politicians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Keep calm and carry on, though pay a thought or two to how we ought to respond to events like these in the future
paragraphs.label: no-unit
